bertrand.dechoux wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I was just looking at Processor and wondering about the use of KeyedProperties in H3. As the configuration is now done through a spring application context, a PropertyOverrideConfigurer can be used to override almost everything. So is there is a reason for the keyedProperties?
> 
> I may be missing something.

KeyedProperties implements what we now call 'overlays' (to avoid 
confusion with Spring's various 'overrides').

It allows the value of a setting to vary based on the context -- usually 
  triggered off the URI-in-progress and current thread -- in which it is 
checked.

For example, it allows the frontier 'minDelayMs' to be the default for 
most URIs, but then for some subset of URIs, usually defined by a SURT 
prefix, assume some other value.

These alternate overlay values are collected in 'Sheet' beans, and 
associated with certain SURT-prefixes or other rulesets via 
'SheetAssociation' beans. (You would only need to consider 
KeyedProperties yourself if implementing your own components that want 
to offer 'overlayable' settings.)

See this part of the H3 User Guide for more details:

https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Sheets

- Gordon @ IA



> 
> Bertrand
